results.title: Arkady Leokum's Tell Me Why
results.brief_description: Based on the best selling book series by Arkady Leokum this series of videos answers questions that children commonly ask on a wide variety of subjects. Colourful graphics and exciting film footage combined with quick search numbers on screen make this an easy to use and fun learning tool.

group_works.title: Life forms, animals and animal oddities

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Devil's Marbles and the Olgas
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
The film provides a geological background to residuals in an arid landscape. It shows the influence of jointing and physical and chemical weathering on rocks. Particularly stressed are spheroidal weathering, freeze-thaw, coalescing alluvial fans and the influence of vegetation on rocks.
results.description:

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Peach and pear harvester
results.brief_description: Picture only. Footage of specialised machine used for quickly removing fruit from peach and pair trees. The machine envelopes a tree and then vibrates which causes the fruit to fall off into a catching device. This is an odd process to view as the tree is shaken quite violently by the machine and the fruit falls into the catching device in a dramamtic fashion.

results.title: The Argentine ant
results.brief_description: This film describes the methods used by State and Municipal authorities and C.S.I.R.O. to eradicate the Argentine Ant in large suburban and city areas. The efforts of individual householders to eradicate the pest have proved unsuccessful. The film shows, in detail, the large scale methods developed by the C.S.I.R.O. which have been used systematically and methodically in attempting to eradicate the pest.

results.title: Come September
results.brief_description:
Opens with the showgrounds devoid of people, livestock and produce, before contrasting this with the show in full swing.

Includes footage of people wandering around, livestock, produce, rides, food and ‘fun’ being had.

No narration, only location sound and upbeat music. This makes for a sophisticated and enoyable film, where the experiences of the people it captures are the focus.

Nice ‘night’ sequence with fireworks.

Great hand-painted credits that mimic various signs allready up at the showgrounds.

Great film!

results.title: Dressing a Chicken
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description:
Please be advised, this film features footage of dead animals.

Produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, this short instructional film demonstrates the correct method for cleaning and dressing poultry. The film is an interesting historical insight into the changing nature of food production and distribution. It would once have been normal for people to handle a fresh chicken carcass rather than a pre-prepared one from the butcher, and the size of the chicken is considerably smaller than today’s standards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Green Fingers: Pest and Disease Control
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this is an archival film and contemporary advice should be sought when handling chemicals and poisons.

‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Pest and Disease Control’, Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to use agricultural sprays on a rose garden at Burnley Gardens.

Diseases described include black spot, aphids and powdery mildew. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
